summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a witness, identified as a sibling of an alleged victim. The witness provides background on their family, details their and their sibling's interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in the mid-to-late 1990s, and discusses the sibling's subsequent revelations of abuse and financial ties to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a 'godfather figure' who approached the witness's sibling at a young age, provided gifts and housing, and is the central figure in the abuse allegations discussed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Present with Epstein during meetings with the witness and their sibling; described as Epstein's girlfriend/partner and the sibling's employer/assistant, whom the sibling described as 'MAXWELL's slave'.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the witness's sibling met at Mar-a-Lago around 1997/1998, with Epstein and Maxwell present.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the witness's sibling met, with Maxwell present, who asked what the sibling did, to which Maxwell replied the sibling was 'her slave'.

connections.description: Described as being together during social interactions with the witness's family; Maxwell presented as Epstein's girlfriend/partner and was involved in managing interactions with the sibling.
Epstein cultivated a relationship with the sibling from a young age, providing gifts, travel, housing, and cash; the sibling later revealed she was raped by Epstein for years.
The sibling worked for Maxwell, who described the sibling as her assistant and 'slave'; they traveled together to events.
The witness met Epstein several times, spoke to him on the phone, and stayed at an apartment Epstein owned. Epstein also provided a computer to the witness's family.

events.title: Sibling meets Epstein at Interlochen
events.description: The witness's sibling first started talking about Jeffrey Epstein with admiration while at Interlochen arts camp. Epstein, who knew their deceased father, approached her at picnic tables.

events.title: Sibling moves to New York City
events.description: The sibling moved to New York City for her senior year of high school, staying at Epstein's seven-story house. Travel arrangements, possibly private, were made for her.

events.title: Meeting with Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago
events.description: The witness's sibling told the witness she met Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago with Epstein and Maxwell present.

events.title: Sibling first reveals abuse
events.description: When the first Epstein investigation became news, the sibling subtly mentioned what happened to her. Later, she explicitly stated she was 'raped by a pedophile for years'.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness is interviewed by the FBI and AUSAs in New York, providing detailed background and allegations regarding Epstein, Maxwell, and his sibling.

locations: One Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York (interview location)
New York City (Epstein's seven-story house and apartment)
keyFacts: The witness's sibling first met Jeffrey Epstein around age 14-15 at Interlochen arts camp, where Epstein cultivated a relationship by invoking admiration for her deceased father.
The sibling later revealed she was 'raped by a pedophile for years' by Epstein and described herself as Ghislaine Maxwell's 'slave' who was paid to work for Epstein.
Epstein provided significant financial benefits to the sibling and her family, including cash, a computer, payment for Interlochen, co-signing a lease, and the use of his properties.
The sibling had social interactions with high-profile figures including Donald Trump and Bill Clinton in the presence of Epstein and Maxwell.
The witness's mother attempted to protect the sibling from media and initially denied knowledge of the abuse, creating family tension.
